availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel B. Pell (Hancock County, KY, farmer and sheriff)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer, politician, and sheriff. Virginia native. Married to Sarah Pell. Father of Thomas J. Pell, W. C. Pell, and S. B. Pell, Jr. Sheriff of Hancock County in 1854. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Hancock County from 1855 to 1857. One of the founders of the Lewisport Pond Draining Company in 1858. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860. Sheriff of Hancock County in 1864. Killed as a result of Confederate guerilla raids in Hancock County in August 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 983.
"An Act to Incorporate the Lewisport Pond Draining Company," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort, KY: A. G. Hodges, Public Printer, 1858), 234-38.
John Livingston, Livingston's Law Register: A Guide for Every Man of Business, and Hand-book of Useful Knowledge (New York: Office of the Monthly Law Magazine, 1854), 346.
Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collinsâ€™ Historical Sketches of Kentucky: History of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Collins & Company, 1878), 305.
